threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Disable power options

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Monero Crypto Coin Mining Pool Lookup
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious DNS queries to Monero mining pools

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: New RUN Key Pointing to Suspicious Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious new RUN key element pointing to an executable in a suspicious folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Markus Neis, Sander Wiebing, Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Network Communication With Crypto Mining Pool
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects initiated network connections to crypto mining pools
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of WinAPI Functions via the commandline. As seen used by threat actors via the tool winapiexec

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Script Interpreter Execution From Suspicious Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a suspicious script execution in temporary folders or folders accessible by environment variables
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the usage of binaries such as 'net', 'sc' or 'powershell' in order to stop, pause, disable or delete critical or important Windows services such as AV, Backup, etc. As seen being used in some ransomware scripts
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), frack113 , X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "-ExecutionPolicy" flag.
Detects programs that connect to uncommon destination ports

match_context.values: @{RuleName=Proxy; DestinationPort=8080; DestinationIp=176.160.157.96; Protocol=tcp; SourceIp=172.16.1.2; DestinationIsIpv6=false; EventID=3; SourceIsIpv6=false; Image=C:\Windows\System32\dllhost.exe; SourcePort=58160; Initiated=true}

@{SourceIsIpv6=false; DestinationPort=8080; DestinationIp=176.160.157.96; Protocol=tcp; SourceIp=192.168.122.100; DestinationIsIpv6=false; EventID=3; Image=c:\windows\system32\dllhost.exe; SourcePort=49706; Initiated=true}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious DNS Query for IP Lookup Service APIs
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects DNS queries for IP lookup services such as "api.ipify.org" originating from a non browser process.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: ADS Zone.Identifier Deleted By Uncommon Application
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the deletion of the "Zone.Identifier" ADS by an uncommon process. Attackers can leverage this in order to bypass security restrictions that make use of the ADS such as Microsoft Office apps.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Network Connection to IP Lookup Service APIs
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects external IP address lookups by non-browser processes via services such as "api.ipify.org". This could be indicative of potential post compromise internet test activity.
Detects requests to exclude files, folders or processes from Antivirus scanning using PowerShell cmdlets

match_context.values: @{Hashes=MD5=04029E121A0CFA5991749937DD22A1D9,SHA256=9F914D42706FE215501044ACD85A32D58AAEF1419D404FDDFA5D3B48F66CCD9F,IMPHASH=7C955A0ABC747F57CCC4324480737EF7; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.19041.546 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\miner.exe" ; CommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe Add-MpPreference -ExclusionPath @($env:UserProfile, $env:ProgramData) -ExclusionExtension '.exe' -Force; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\miner.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects usage of "Reflection.Assembly" load functions to dynamically load assemblies in memory
Detects potentially suspicious keywords that could indicate the use of a PowerShell exploitation framework
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Perez Diego (@darkquassar), Tuan Le (NCSGroup)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects modifications to the Windows Defender configuration settings using PowerShell to add exclusions

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Files With System Process Name In Unsuspected Locations
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects the creation of an executable with a system process name in folders other than the system ones (System32, SysWOW64, etc.).
It is highly recommended to perform an initial baseline before using this rule in production.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Sander Wiebing, Tim Shelton, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET MALWARE Common Stealer Behavior - Source IP Associated with Hosting Provider Check via ip.api .com
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET MALWARE Common Stealer Behavior - Source IP Associated with Hosting Provider Check via ip.api .com"; flow:established,to_server; urilen:21; http.method; content:"GET"; http.uri; content:"|2f|line|2f 3f|fields|3d|hosting"; fast_pattern; http.header_names; bsize:22; content:"|0d 0a|host|0d 0a|connection|0d 0a 0d 0a|"; nocase; http.host; bsize:10; content:"ip-api.com"; http.connection; bsize:10; content:"Keep-Alive"; threshold:type limit,count 1,seconds 300,track by_src; classtype:trojan-activity; sid:2062720; rev:4; metadata:affected_product Windows_XP_Vista_7_8_10_Server_32_64_Bit, attack_target Client_Endpoint, tls_state plaintext, created_at 2025_06_03, deployment Perimeter, former_category HUNTING, confidence Medium, signature_severity Critical, updated_at 2025_06_09; target:src_ip;)
